title: A mother, 26, is arrested for 'abandoning her newborn baby with a bus driver'
text:
A woman has been accused of abandoning her one-month-old child with a bus driver.

Police said the Pennsylvania mother, Ashley Leann Walters, 26, said she could no longer care for her newborn and handed the baby to the bus driver.

Court documents indicate Walters boarded the LANTA bus in Bethlehem Saturday afternoon, placed her son on the fare box and told the driver to call police because 'this was her son that she can't take care of.'

Cops said the baby was wearing a diaper and was taken to Lehigh Valley Hospital-Muhlenberg for a medical evaluation.

A woman is accused of dropping off her baby at a LANTA bus like the one pictured, saying she couldn't care for him

Pennsylvania does have a Safe Haven Law, which permits parents to drop off babies 28 days or younger at a hospital or police precinct.

After exiting the bus in tears, she was found a hundred yards away, based on the description provided by the driver.

One rider told ABC6 that the woman shouldn't face any consequences for actions, saying: 'Personally, I think you should take it to the right authority, but in the same respects, taking it to a bus driver they can make sure the baby is taken care of.'

But police did charge her with child endangerment for abandoning the baby and not making the appropriate arrangements to ensure his care and safety.

Walters was sent to Northampton County Prison in lieu of 10 percent of $10,000 bail.
description: The Pennsylvania mother, Ashley Walters, 26, is accused of handing off her one-month-old son to a bus driver. Walters allegedly told the Bethlehem driver that 'she can't take care of' her son.
